headline.main: Walk in the Park: Encouraging Physical Activity in Communities

byline.original: By JENNIFER CUTRARO and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

docs.abstract: Considering how community members tend to commute to school and work and get around town, and working in "task forces" to develop proposals to promote physical activity.
docs.snippet: Considering how community members tend to commute to school and work and get around town, and working in "task forces" to develop proposals to promote physical activity.

headline.main: Walk in the Park: Encouraging Physical Activity in Communities

byline.original: By JENNIFER CUTRARO and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

docs.abstract: Considering how community members tend to commute to school and work and get around town, and working in "task forces" to develop proposals to promote physical activity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Overview | How can people be encouraged to be more physically active? In this lesson, students read about ways to make streets safer for pedestrians and bicyclists. They learn about the health benefits associated with pedestrian-friendly communities, assess their own community's level of pedestrian and cyclist access and make recommendations for improving these neighborhood attributes.
docs.snippet: Considering how community members tend to commute to school and work and get around town, and working in "task forces" to develop proposals to promote physical activity.

headline.seo: Walmart to Add ‘Great for You’ Label to Healthy Foods
headline.print_headline: To Promote Healthier Food Choices, Walmart Adds Labels

docs.abstract: Walmart announces standards to identify and label healthy foods it sells as part of its promise to improve the nutritional quality of its products; labels will bear the words Great for You on the retailer's store brand items, as well as on signs around fresh fruits and vegetable displays; Walmart will allow other brands to use the label without paying any licensing fee on products that are up to its standards and meet certain criteria; move acknowledges Walmart's influential role in the health of American families.
docs.lead_paragraph: As part of a plan to improve the nutritional quality of the food it sells, Walmart said that it would begin placing a label with the words Great for You on its Great Value and Marketside food items.
docs.snippet: As part of a plan to improve the nutritional quality of the food it sells, Walmart said that it would begin placing a label with the words Great for You on its Great Value and Marketside food items.

headline.seo: Mindful Eating as Way to Fight Bingeing
headline.main: Mindful Eating as Food for Thought

docs.abstract: Mindful eating is a concept that has its roots in Buddhist teachings and encourages people to eat slowly, paying close attention to the sensation and purpose of each morsel; in the eyes of some experts, what seems like the simplest of acts, eating slowly and genuinely relishing each bite, could be the remedy for a fast-paced society in which an endless parade of new diets never seems to slow a stampede toward obesity.
docs.lead_paragraph: A concept based on Buddhist teachings encourages people to eat slowly, paying close attention to the sensation and purpose of each morsel.
docs.snippet: A concept based on Buddhist teachings encourages people to eat slowly, paying close attention to the sensation and purpose of each morsel.
